member.name: T:Amazon.IotData.AmazonIotDataClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing IotData
IoT data
IoT data enables secure, bi-directional communication between Internet-connected things (such as sensors, actuators, embedded devices, or smart appliances) and the Amazon Web Services cloud. It implements a broker for applications and things to publish messages over HTTP (Publish) and retrieve, update, and delete shadows. A shadow is a persistent representation of your things and their state in the Amazon Web Services cloud.
Find the endpoint address for actions in IoT data by running this CLI command:
aws iot describe-endpoint --endpoint-type iot:Data-ATS
The service name used by Amazon Web ServicesSignature Version 4 to sign requests is: iotdevicegateway.

member.name: M:Amazon.IotData.AmazonIotDataClient.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonIotDataClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The URL of the search or document service.

member.name: M:Amazon.IotData.AmazonIotDataClient.DeleteThingShadowAsync(Amazon.IotData.Model.DeleteThingShadowRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Deletes the shadow for the specified thing.
Requires permission to access the DeleteThingShadow action.
For more information, see DeleteThingShadow in the IoT Developer Guide.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DeleteThingShadow service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the DeleteThingShadow service method, as returned by IotData.
member.exception: The specified combination of HTTP verb and URI is not supported.
The specified resource does not exist.
You are not authorized to perform this operation.
The document encoding is not supported.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for DeleteThingShadow Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.IotData.AmazonIotDataClient.GetRetainedMessageAsync(Amazon.IotData.Model.GetRetainedMessageRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Gets the details of a single retained message for the specified topic.
This action returns the message payload of the retained message, which can incur messaging costs. To list only the topic names of the retained messages, call ListRetainedMessages.
Requires permission to access the GetRetainedMessage action.
For more information about messaging costs, see Amazon Web Services IoT Core pricing - Messaging.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetRetainedMessage service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the GetRetainedMessage service method, as returned by IotData.
member.exception: The specified combination of HTTP verb and URI is not supported.
The specified resource does not exist.
You are not authorized to perform this operation.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetRetainedMessage Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.IotData.AmazonIotDataClient.ListRetainedMessagesAsync(Amazon.IotData.Model.ListRetainedMessagesRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Lists summary information about the retained messages stored for the account.
This action returns only the topic names of the retained messages. It doesn't return any message payloads. Although this action doesn't return a message payload, it can still incur messaging costs.
To get the message payload of a retained message, call GetRetainedMessage with the topic name of the retained message.
Requires permission to access the ListRetainedMessages action.
For more information about messaging costs, see Amazon Web Services IoT Core pricing - Messaging.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ListRetainedMessages service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the ListRetainedMessages service method, as returned by IotData.
member.exception: The specified combination of HTTP verb and URI is not supported.
You are not authorized to perform this operation.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for ListRetainedMessages Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.IotData.AmazonIotDataClient.PublishAsync(Amazon.IotData.Model.PublishRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Publishes an MQTT message.
Requires permission to access the Publish action.
For more information about MQTT messages, see MQTT Protocol in the IoT Developer Guide.
For more information about messaging costs, see Amazon Web Services IoT Core pricing - Messaging.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the Publish service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the Publish service method, as returned by IotData.
member.exception: The specified combination of HTTP verb and URI is not supported.
You are not authorized to perform this operation.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for Publish Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.IotData.AmazonIotDataDefaultConfiguration.GetAllConfigurations
member.summary: Collection of all s supported by IotData

summary.p: The STANDARD mode provides the latest recommended default values that should be safe to run in most scenarios
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The IN_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services from within the same AWS region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The CROSS_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services in a different region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The MOBILE mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for mobile applications
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The AUTO mode is an experimental mode that builds on the standard mode. The SDK will attempt to discover the execution environment to determine the appropriate settings automatically.

Note that the auto detection is heuristics-based and does not guarantee 100% accuracy. STANDARD mode will be used if the execution environment cannot be determined. The auto detection might query EC2 Instance Metadata service, which might introduce latency. Therefore we recommend choosing an explicit defaults_mode instead if startup latency is critical to your application
The LEGACY mode provides default settings that vary per SDK and were used prior to establishment of defaults_mode

member.name: T:Amazon.IotData.Internal.AmazonIotDataEndpointProvider
member.summary: Amazon IotData endpoint provider. Resolves endpoint for given set of IotDataEndpointParameters. Can throw AmazonClientException if endpoint resolution is unsuccessful.

member.name: M:Amazon.IotData.Internal.AmazonIotDataEndpointProvider.ResolveEndpoint(Amazon.Runtime.Endpoints.EndpointParameters)
member.summary: Resolve endpoint for IotDataEndpointParameters

member.name: T:Amazon.IotData.Internal.AmazonIotDataEndpointResolver
member.summary: Amazon IotData endpoint resolver. Custom PipelineHandler responsible for resolving endpoint and setting authentication parameters for IotData service requests. Collects values for IotDataEndpointParameters and then tries to resolve endpoint by calling ResolveEndpoint method on GlobalEndpoints.Provider if present, otherwise uses IotDataEndpointProvider. Responsible for setting authentication and http headers provided by resolved endpoint.

Requires permission to access the DeleteThingShadow action.
For more information, see DeleteThingShadow in the IoT Developer Guide.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ShadowName.
The name of the shadow.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.DeleteThingShadowRequest.ThingName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ThingName.
The name of the thing.

member.summary: The output from the DeleteThingShadow operation.

The state information, in JSON format.

member.name: T:Amazon.IotData.Model.GetRetainedMessageRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetRetainedMessage operation. Gets the details of a single retained message for the specified topic.
This action returns the message payload of the retained message, which can incur messaging costs. To list only the topic names of the retained messages, call ListRetainedMessages.
Requires permission to access the GetRetainedMessage action.
For more information about messaging costs, see Amazon Web Services IoT Core pricing - Messaging.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.GetRetainedMessageRequest.Topic
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Topic.
The topic name of the retained message to retrieve.

member.name: T:Amazon.IotData.Model.GetRetainedMessageResponse
member.summary: The output from the GetRetainedMessage operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.GetRetainedMessageResponse.LastModifiedTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastModifiedTime.
The Epoch date and time, in milliseconds, when the retained message was stored by IoT.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.GetRetainedMessageResponse.Payload
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Payload.
The Base64-encoded message payload of the retained message body.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.GetRetainedMessageResponse.Qos
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Qos.
The quality of service (QoS) level used to publish the retained message.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.GetRetainedMessageResponse.Topic
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Topic.
The topic name to which the retained message was published.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.GetRetainedMessageResponse.UserProperties
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserProperties.
A base64-encoded JSON string that includes an array of JSON objects, or null if the retained message doesn't include any user properties.
The following example userProperties parameter is a JSON string that represents two user properties. Note that it will be base64-encoded:
[{"deviceName": "alpha"}, {"deviceCnt": "45"}]

member.name: T:Amazon.IotData.Model.ListNamedShadowsForThingRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ListNamedShadowsForThing operation. Lists the shadows for the specified thing.
Requires permission to access the ListNamedShadowsForThing action.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.ListNamedShadowsForThingRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The token to retrieve the next set of results.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.ListNamedShadowsForThingRequest.PageSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PageSize.
The result page size.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.ListNamedShadowsForThingRequest.ThingName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ThingName.
The name of the thing.

member.name: T:Amazon.IotData.Model.ListNamedShadowsForThingResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListNamedShadowsForThing operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.ListNamedShadowsForThingResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The token to use to get the next set of results, or null if there are no additional results.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.ListNamedShadowsForThingResponse.Results
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Results.
The list of shadows for the specified thing.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.ListNamedShadowsForThingResponse.Timestamp
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Timestamp.
The Epoch date and time the response was generated by IoT.

member.name: T:Amazon.IotData.Model.ListRetainedMessagesRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ListRetainedMessages operation. Lists summary information about the retained messages stored for the account.
This action returns only the topic names of the retained messages. It doesn't return any message payloads. Although this action doesn't return a message payload, it can still incur messaging costs.
To get the message payload of a retained message, call GetRetainedMessage with the topic name of the retained message.
Requires permission to access the ListRetainedMessages action.
For more information about messaging costs, see Amazon Web Services IoT Core pricing - Messaging.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.ListRetainedMessagesRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of results to return at one time.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.ListRetainedMessagesRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
To retrieve the next set of results, the nextToken value from a previous response; otherwise null to receive the first set of results.

member.name: T:Amazon.IotData.Model.ListRetainedMessagesResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListRetainedMessages operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.ListRetainedMessagesResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The token for the next set of results, or null if there are no additional results.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.ListRetainedMessagesResponse.RetainedTopics
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RetainedTopics.
A summary list the account's retained messages. The information returned doesn't include the message payloads of the retained messages.

member.summary: The specified combination of HTTP verb and URI is not supported.

member.name: T:Amazon.IotData.Model.PublishRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the Publish operation. Publishes an MQTT message.
Requires permission to access the Publish action.
For more information about MQTT messages, see MQTT Protocol in the IoT Developer Guide.
For more information about messaging costs, see Amazon Web Services IoT Core pricing - Messaging.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.PublishRequest.ContentType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContentType.
A UTF-8 encoded string that describes the content of the publishing message.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.PublishRequest.CorrelationData
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CorrelationData.
The base64-encoded binary data used by the sender of the request message to identify which request the response message is for when it's received. correlationData is an HTTP header value in the API.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.PublishRequest.MessageExpiry
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MessageExpiry.
A user-defined integer value that represents the message expiry interval in seconds. If absent, the message doesn't expire. For more information about the limits of messageExpiry, see Amazon Web Services IoT Core message broker and protocol limits and quotas from the Amazon Web Services Reference Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.PublishRequest.Payload
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Payload.
The message body. MQTT accepts text, binary, and empty (null) message payloads.
Publishing an empty (null) payload with retain = true deletes the retained message identified by topic from Amazon Web Services IoT Core.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.PublishRequest.PayloadFormatIndicator
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PayloadFormatIndicator.
An Enum string value that indicates whether the payload is formatted as UTF-8. payloadFormatIndicator is an HTTP header value in the API.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.PublishRequest.Qos
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Qos.
The Quality of Service (QoS) level. The default QoS level is 0.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.PublishRequest.ResponseTopic
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResponseTopic.
A UTF-8 encoded string that's used as the topic name for a response message. The response topic is used to describe the topic which the receiver should publish to as part of the request-response flow. The topic must not contain wildcard characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.PublishRequest.Retain
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Retain.
A Boolean value that determines whether to set the RETAIN flag when the message is published.
Setting the RETAIN flag causes the message to be retained and sent to new subscribers to the topic.
Valid values: true | false
Default value: false

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.PublishRequest.Topic
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Topic.
The name of the MQTT topic.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.PublishRequest.UserProperties
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserProperties.
A JSON string that contains an array of JSON objects. If you dont use Amazon Web Services SDK or CLI, you must encode the JSON string to base64 format before adding it to the HTTP header. userProperties is an HTTP header value in the API.
The following example userProperties parameter is a JSON string which represents two User Properties. Note that it needs to be base64-encoded:
[{"deviceName": "alpha"}, {"deviceCnt": "45"}]

member.name: T:Amazon.IotData.Model.PublishResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the Publish operation.

member.summary: Information about a single retained message.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.RetainedMessageSummary.LastModifiedTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastModifiedTime.
The Epoch date and time, in milliseconds, when the retained message was stored by IoT.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.RetainedMessageSummary.PayloadSize
member.summary:

The size of the retained message's payload in bytes.

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.RetainedMessageSummary.Qos

member.name: P:Amazon.IotData.Model.RetainedMessageSummary.Topic

The topic name to which the retained message was published.

member.name: T:Amazon.IotData.IAmazonIotData
member.summary:
Interface for accessing IotData
IoT data
IoT data enables secure, bi-directional communication between Internet-connected things (such as sensors, actuators, embedded devices, or smart appliances) and the Amazon Web Services cloud. It implements a broker for applications and things to publish messages over HTTP (Publish) and retrieve, update, and delete shadows. A shadow is a persistent representation of your things and their state in the Amazon Web Services cloud.
Find the endpoint address for actions in IoT data by running this CLI command:
aws iot describe-endpoint --endpoint-type iot:Data-ATS
The service name used by Amazon Web ServicesSignature Version 4 to sign requests is: iotdevicegateway.

member.summary: Paginators for the service

member.name: M:Amazon.IotData.IAmazonIotData.DeleteThingShadowAsync(Amazon.IotData.Model.DeleteThingShadowRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Deletes the shadow for the specified thing.
Requires permission to access the DeleteThingShadow action.
For more information, see DeleteThingShadow in the IoT Developer Guide.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DeleteThingShadow service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the DeleteThingShadow service method, as returned by IotData.
member.exception: The specified combination of HTTP verb and URI is not supported.
The specified resource does not exist.
You are not authorized to perform this operation.
The document encoding is not supported.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for DeleteThingShadow Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.IotData.IAmazonIotData.GetRetainedMessageAsync(Amazon.IotData.Model.GetRetainedMessageRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Gets the details of a single retained message for the specified topic.
This action returns the message payload of the retained message, which can incur messaging costs. To list only the topic names of the retained messages, call ListRetainedMessages.
Requires permission to access the GetRetainedMessage action.
For more information about messaging costs, see Amazon Web Services IoT Core pricing - Messaging.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetRetainedMessage service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the GetRetainedMessage service method, as returned by IotData.
member.exception: The specified combination of HTTP verb and URI is not supported.
The specified resource does not exist.
You are not authorized to perform this operation.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetRetainedMessage Operation

Requires permission to access the GetThingShadow action.
For more information, see GetThingShadow in the IoT Developer Guide.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetThingShadow service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.

member.exception: The specified combination of HTTP verb and URI is not supported.
The specified resource does not exist.
You are not authorized to perform this operation.
The document encoding is not supported.

member.name: M:Amazon.IotData.IAmazonIotData.ListRetainedMessagesAsync(Amazon.IotData.Model.ListRetainedMessagesRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Lists summary information about the retained messages stored for the account.
This action returns only the topic names of the retained messages. It doesn't return any message payloads. Although this action doesn't return a message payload, it can still incur messaging costs.
To get the message payload of a retained message, call GetRetainedMessage with the topic name of the retained message.
Requires permission to access the ListRetainedMessages action.
For more information about messaging costs, see Amazon Web Services IoT Core pricing - Messaging.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ListRetainedMessages service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the ListRetainedMessages service method, as returned by IotData.
member.exception: The specified combination of HTTP verb and URI is not supported.
You are not authorized to perform this operation.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for ListRetainedMessages Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.IotData.IAmazonIotData.PublishAsync(Amazon.IotData.Model.PublishRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Publishes an MQTT message.
Requires permission to access the Publish action.
For more information about MQTT messages, see MQTT Protocol in the IoT Developer Guide.
For more information about messaging costs, see Amazon Web Services IoT Core pricing - Messaging.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the Publish service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the Publish service method, as returned by IotData.
member.exception: The specified combination of HTTP verb and URI is not supported.
You are not authorized to perform this operation.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for Publish Operation
